intro: Montira, commonly known as the common thornapple, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Solanaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy purple or blue flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruits are toxic and resemble small apples, containing alkaloids that can be harmful if ingested. Montira is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
